intro: Lannea ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's lannea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into edible, round fruits. The fruit has a thick, spiny rind and a sweet, fleshy pulp that contains several seeds. It is often found in forested areas and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates.
